oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of aliovalent doping on the electrical conductivity of the Li2SO4-Na2SO4 binary
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GOMATHY, S
SHUKLA, M
GOPALAN, P
KULKARNI, AR
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: paddle-wheel mechanism
ionic-conductivity
solid electrolytes

ionic conductivity
phase transitions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The effect of aliovalent doping (La3+) on the electrical conductivity of the 75: 25 and 10:90 Li2SO4 - Na2SO4 binary compositions is reported. While no significant conductivity enhancement is observed for the 75:25 composition, the sodium sulfate rich composition exhibits considerable enhancement, attributed to an increased vacancy concentration. For the 10:90 composition, the maximum enhancement is observed with 2 m/o La-2(SO4)(3) at 225 degreesC and with 3 m/o La-2(SO4)(3) at 395 degreesC. Interestingly, the Na2SO4 -rich and the Li2SO4 -rich compositions exhibit conductivity behavior consistent with that for pure Na2SO4 and pure Li2SO4, respectively. (C) 2001 . .
